_comment: TEMPLATE: Filter Configuration - Copy this file and rename it to '[viewname]-filters.json'
_description: Configure column-based filters that appear above the table. Users can filter data before it's displayed.
_usage: Set enabled to true and configure filters for each column you want to be filterable.

_options.enabled: true/false - Enable/disable the entire filter system
_options.position: 'top' or 'bottom' - Where to display filters relative to the table

_options.columnIndex: Zero-based index of the column to filter (0 = first column)
_options.label: Label text shown above the filter
_options.colSize: Bootstrap column class for layout (col-md-2, col-md-3, col-md-4, etc.)
_options.options: Array of {value, label} pairs for dropdown choices

_options.placeholder: Placeholder text shown in empty input field

_options.type: 'dateRange' - Two date pickers for start and end dates
'numberRange' - Two number inputs for min and max values
_options.placeholder: Object with 'min' and 'max' properties for each input

_colSizeOptions: col-md-2  (16.66% width - use for narrow filters like status)
col-md-3  (25% width - use for medium filters)
col-md-4  (33.33% width - use for date ranges or larger text inputs)
col-md-6  (50% width - use for very wide filters)
col-md-12 (100% width - use for full-width filters)
_bestPractices: columnIndex must match the actual column position (0-based)
Total colSize should add up to 12 or less per row for Bootstrap grid
Use select filters for categorical data (status, type, category)
Use text filters for searchable content (names, descriptions)
Use numberRange for numeric data (amounts, counts)
Provide clear placeholders for text inputs
Test filter combinations to ensure they work together
Consider mobile users - fewer filters = better mobile UX
